original: ENGSTRÖM, Wilhelm S L, Ingenjör, Stockholm, f Malmö 26/4 81 av folkskoll N E 0 Elna Larsson, gm Ellen Svensson. H a l, Tekn sk Malmö, 4-år prakt utbildn v verkst 1 Sv o Tyskl, dipl fr Technikum Apolda Thii-ringen 03, stud tekn högsk Charlottenburg, komplett stud i Tyskl, Engl o USA i psyko-tekn, verkst.org o verktygsmaskinlära mm. Ass åt dr F Gilbreth o F W Taylor v Tay-lor-syst:s inför v New Engl Butt Comp i Providence, ritkont.prakt v H J Ohlsson & Söner Malmö samt Arlövs Vaggonfabr 03—05, verkst.ch AB Åkermans mek verkst Eslöv 08—11, chefkonstr v Beanien & Smiths Comp (verktygsmaskiner) Providence 12—14, verkst.ch AB Götavkns maskinverkstäd (org till-verkn av stordieselmaskiner) 14—19, start Spec.maskiner i Gbg AB 19, inneh detta 19— 21, bedrev konsult verksamh, spec inom mod tillverkn.tekn, 22—24, verkst.ch AB Gerh Arehns mek verkst Sthlm sed. 24. Styr.suppl Sthlms tekn inell.sk, styr.ordf Sthlms tekn lärov :s yrkesnmd. Fd ordf i Verkst.ch :s frb (nuv Sv verkst.ing:s frn), medl Sv tekn.frn, Sv uppfinnarfrn, Tekn samf i Gbg, led Sv mek verkstad :s standardiser.komm (SMS) samt fi subkomm. Studie-o aff.res t flert europ länd samt USA. Av trycket: Handl f svarvare, Handledn f fräsare, Indeln o växel-hjulsberäkning f fräsmaskiner, Stångbrot-schning, Handledn f slipare (samtl på tidskr Verkstad :s förl), Mätverktyg o mätme-toder inom d mek verkst.ind (utg av Sv ma-skinind.frnX mångår medarb i tidskr Verkstäderna. RVO; Odd Fellow.
translated: ENGSTRÖM, Wilhelm S L, Engineer, Stockholm, born Malmö 26/4 1881, son of elementary school teacher N E Elna Larsson and Ellen Svensson. Married to, but divorced from, Ellen Svensson. Technical school in Malmö, 4 years of practical training in machinery at the Swedish and German workshops, diploma from Technikum Apolda Thuringen in 1903, studied at the technical university Charlottenburg, completed studies in German, English, and USA in psycho-technology, engineering organization, and machine tool engineering, etc. Assistant to Dr. F Gilbreth and F W Taylor for Taylor's system introduction to New England Butt Company in Providence, worked as a drafting assistant at H J Ohlsson & Söner Malmö and Arlövs Vaggonfabr from 1903 to 1905, worked at AB Åkermans mechanical workshop in Eslöv as a workshop mechanic from 1908 to 1911, chief designer at Beanien & Smiths Company (machine tools) in Providence from 1912 to 1914, worked at AB Götavkns machine workshop (manufacturer of large diesel engines) from 1914 to 1919, started Spec Maskiner i Göteborg AB in 1919, owner since 1919 to 1921, worked as a consultant specializing in model manufacturing technology from 1922 to 1924, worked at AB Gerh Arehns mechanical workshop in Stockholm since 1924. Board member of Stockholm's technical industrial school, chairman of Stockholm's technical college's professional committee. Former chairman of the Engineering Federation (now Swedish Mechanical Engineers Association), member of the Swedish Engineering Association, Swedish Inventors Association, Technical Society in Gothenburg, member of the Swedish Mechanical Workshop's Standardization Committee (SMS) and its subcommittee. Undertook study and business trips to several European countries and the USA. Publications: Handbook for Turner, Guide for Milling Operators, Calculation of Gear Wheels for Milling Machines, Bar Broaching, Guide for Grinding Operators (all published by the Workshop magazine), Measuring Tools and Methods in the Mechanical Workshop Industry (published by the Swedish Machine Industry Association, long-time collaborator with the Workshop magazine). Awarded RVO (Royal Victorian Order); member of the Odd Fellow Society.

career.workplace: Taylor's System Introduction to New England Butt Company
